fields.description: Mode for parsing entities in the text. See formatting options for more details. Entities other than "bold", "italic", "underline", "strikethrough", "spoiler", and "custom_emoji" are ignored.

fields.name: text_entities
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the gift text. It can be specified instead of text_parse_mode. Entities other than "bold", "italic", "underline", "strikethrough", "spoiler", and "custom_emoji" are ignored.

giftPremiumSubscription.name: giftPremiumSubscription
description: Gifts a Telegram Premium subscription to the given user. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user who will receive a Telegram Premium subscription

fields.name: month_count
fields.description: Number of months the Telegram Premium subscription will be active for the user; must be one of 3, 6, or 12

fields.name: star_count
fields.description: Number of Telegram Stars to pay for the Telegram Premium subscription; must be 1000 for 3 months, 1500 for 6 months, and 2500 for 12 months

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text that will be shown along with the service message about the subscription; 0-128 characters

fields.name: text_parse_mode
fields.description: Mode for parsing entities in the text. See formatting options for more details. Entities other than "bold", "italic", "underline", "strikethrough", "spoiler", and "custom_emoji" are ignored.

fields.name: text_entities
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the gift text. It can be specified instead of text_parse_mode. Entities other than "bold", "italic", "underline", "strikethrough", "spoiler", and "custom_emoji" are ignored.

verifyUser.name: verifyUser
description: Verifies a user on behalf of the organization which is represented by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

fields.name: custom_description
fields.description: Custom description for the verification; 0-70 characters. Must be empty if the organization isn't allowed to provide a custom verification description.

verifyChat.name: verifyChat
description: Verifies a chat on behalf of the organization which is represented by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: custom_description
fields.description: Custom description for the verification; 0-70 characters. Must be empty if the organization isn't allowed to provide a custom verification description.

removeUserVerification.name: removeUserVerification
description: Removes verification from a user who is currently verified on behalf of the organization represented by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

removeChatVerification.name: removeChatVerification
description: Removes verification from a chat that is currently verified on behalf of the organization represented by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

readBusinessMessage.name: readBusinessMessage
description: Marks incoming message as read on behalf of a business account. Requires the can_read_messages business bot right. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which to read the message

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the chat in which the message was received. The chat must have been active in the last 24 hours.

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the message to mark as read

deleteBusinessMessages.name: deleteBusinessMessages
description: Delete messages on behalf of a business account. Requires the can_delete_sent_messages business bot right to delete messages sent by the bot itself, or the can_delete_all_messages business bot right to delete any message. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which to delete the messages

fields.name: message_ids
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-100 identifiers of messages to delete. All messages must be from the same chat. See deleteMessage for limitations on which messages can be deleted

setBusinessAccountName.name: setBusinessAccountName
description: Changes the first and last name of a managed business account. Requires the can_change_name business bot right. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: The new value of the first name for the business account; 1-64 characters

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: The new value of the last name for the business account; 0-64 characters

setBusinessAccountUsername.name: setBusinessAccountUsername
description: Changes the username of a managed business account. Requires the can_change_username business bot right. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: username
fields.description: The new value of the username for the business account; 0-32 characters

setBusinessAccountBio.name: setBusinessAccountBio
description: Changes the bio of a managed business account. Requires the can_change_bio business bot right. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: bio
fields.description: The new value of the bio for the business account; 0-140 characters

setBusinessAccountProfilePhoto.name: setBusinessAccountProfilePhoto
description: Changes the profile photo of a managed business account. Requires the can_edit_profile_photo business bot right. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: photo
fields.description: The new profile photo to set

fields.name: is_public
fields.description: Pass True to set the public photo, which will be visible even if the main photo is hidden by the business account's privacy settings. An account can have only one public photo.

removeBusinessAccountProfilePhoto.name: removeBusinessAccountProfilePhoto
description: Removes the current profile photo of a managed business account. Requires the can_edit_profile_photo business bot right. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: is_public
fields.description: Pass True to remove the public photo, which is visible even if the main photo is hidden by the business account's privacy settings. After the main photo is removed, the previous profile photo (if present) becomes the main photo.

setBusinessAccountGiftSettings.name: setBusinessAccountGiftSettings
description: Changes the privacy settings pertaining to incoming gifts in a managed business account. Requires the can_change_gift_settings business bot right. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: show_gift_button
fields.description: Pass True, if a button for sending a gift to the user or by the business account must always be shown in the input field

fields.name: accepted_gift_types
fields.description: Types of gifts accepted by the business account

getBusinessAccountStarBalance.name: getBusinessAccountStarBalance
description: Returns the amount of Telegram Stars owned by a managed business account. Requires the can_view_gifts_and_stars business bot right. Returns StarAmount on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

transferBusinessAccountStars.name: transferBusinessAccountStars
description: Transfers Telegram Stars from the business account balance to the bot's balance. Requires the can_transfer_stars business bot right. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: star_count
fields.description: Number of Telegram Stars to transfer; 1-10000

getBusinessAccountGifts.name: getBusinessAccountGifts
description: Returns the gifts received and owned by a managed business account. Requires the can_view_gifts_and_stars business bot right. Returns OwnedGifts on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: exclude_unsaved
fields.description: Pass True to exclude gifts that aren't saved to the account's profile page

fields.name: exclude_saved
fields.description: Pass True to exclude gifts that are saved to the account's profile page

fields.name: exclude_unlimited
fields.description: Pass True to exclude gifts that can be purchased an unlimited number of times

fields.name: exclude_limited
fields.description: Pass True to exclude gifts that can be purchased a limited number of times

fields.name: exclude_unique
fields.description: Pass True to exclude unique gifts

fields.name: sort_by_price
fields.description: Pass True to sort results by gift price instead of send date. Sorting is applied before pagination.

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results

fields.name: limit
fields.description: The maximum number of gifts to be returned; 1-100. Defaults to 100

convertGiftToStars.name: convertGiftToStars
description: Converts a given regular gift to Telegram Stars. Requires the can_convert_gifts_to_stars business bot right. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: owned_gift_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the regular gift that should be converted to Telegram Stars

upgradeGift.name: upgradeGift
description: Upgrades a given regular gift to a unique gift. Requires the can_transfer_and_upgrade_gifts business bot right. Additionally requires the can_transfer_stars business bot right if the upgrade is paid. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: owned_gift_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the regular gift that should be upgraded to a unique one

fields.name: keep_original_details
fields.description: Pass True to keep the original gift text, sender and receiver in the upgraded gift

fields.name: star_count
fields.description: The amount of Telegram Stars that will be paid for the upgrade from the business account balance. If gift.prepaid_upgrade_star_count > 0, then pass 0, otherwise, the can_transfer_stars business bot right is required and gift.upgrade_star_count must be passed.

transferGift.name: transferGift
description: Transfers an owned unique gift to another user. Requires the can_transfer_and_upgrade_gifts business bot right. Requires can_transfer_stars business bot right if the transfer is paid. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: owned_gift_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the regular gift that should be transferred

fields.name: new_owner_chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the chat which will own the gift. The chat must be active in the last 24 hours.

fields.name: star_count
fields.description: The amount of Telegram Stars that will be paid for the transfer from the business account balance. If positive, then the can_transfer_stars business bot right is required.

postStory.name: postStory
description: Posts a story on behalf of a managed business account. Requires the can_manage_stories business bot right. Returns Story on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: content
fields.description: Content of the story

fields.name: active_period
fields.description: Period after which the story is moved to the archive, in seconds; must be one of 6 * 3600, 12 * 3600, 86400, or 2 * 86400

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Caption of the story, 0-2048 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Mode for parsing entities in the story caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: areas
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of clickable areas to be shown on the story

fields.name: post_to_chat_page
fields.description: Pass True to keep the story accessible after it expires

fields.name: protect_content
fields.description: Pass True if the content of the story must be protected from forwarding and screenshotting

editStory.name: editStory
description: Edits a story previously posted by the bot on behalf of a managed business account. Requires the can_manage_stories business bot right. Returns Story on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: story_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the story to edit

fields.name: content
fields.description: Content of the story

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Caption of the story, 0-2048 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Mode for parsing entities in the story caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: areas
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of clickable areas to be shown on the story

deleteStory.name: deleteStory
description: Deletes a story previously posted by the bot on behalf of a managed business account. Requires the can_manage_stories business bot right. Returns True on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: story_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the story to delete

sendSticker.name: sendSticker
description: Use this method to send static .WEBP, animated .TGS, or video .WEBM stickers. On success, the sent Message is returned.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: message_thread_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: Sticker to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a .WEBP sticker from the Internet, or upload a new .WEBP, .TGS, or .WEBM sticker using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files. Video and animated stickers can't be sent via an HTTP URL.

fields.name: emoji
fields.description: Emoji associated with the sticker; only for just uploaded stickers

fields.name: disable_notification
fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: protect_content
fields.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

fields.name: allow_paid_broadcast
fields.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

fields.name: message_effect_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

fields.name: reply_parameters
fields.description: Description of the message to reply to

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove a reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user

getStickerSet.name: getStickerSet
description: Use this method to get a sticker set. On success, a StickerSet object is returned.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the sticker set

getCustomEmojiStickers.name: getCustomEmojiStickers
description: Use this method to get information about custom emoji stickers by their identifiers. Returns an Array of Sticker objects.

fields.name: custom_emoji_ids
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of custom emoji identifiers. At most 200 custom emoji identifiers can be specified.

uploadStickerFile.name: uploadStickerFile
description: Use this method to upload a file with a sticker for later use in the createNewStickerSet, addStickerToSet, or replaceStickerInSet methods (the file can be used multiple times). Returns the uploaded File on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of sticker file owner

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: A file with the sticker in .WEBP, .PNG, .TGS, or .WEBM format. See https://core.telegram.org/stickers for technical requirements. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

fields.name: sticker_format
fields.description: Format of the sticker, must be one of "static", "animated", "video"

createNewStickerSet.name: createNewStickerSet
description: Use this method to create a new sticker set owned by a user. The bot will be able to edit the sticker set thus created. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of created sticker set owner

fields.name: name
fields.description: Short name of sticker set, to be used in t.me/addstickers/ URLs (e.g., animals). Can contain only English letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in "_by_<bot_username>". <bot_username> is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

fields.name: stickers
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-50 initial stickers to be added to the sticker set

fields.name: sticker_type
fields.description: Type of stickers in the set, pass "regular", "mask", or "custom_emoji". By default, a regular sticker set is created.

fields.name: needs_repainting
fields.description: Pass True if stickers in the sticker set must be repainted to the color of text when used in messages, the accent color if used as emoji status, white on chat photos, or another appropriate color based on context; for custom emoji sticker sets only

addStickerToSet.name: addStickerToSet
description: Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot. Emoji sticker sets can have up to 200 stickers. Other sticker sets can have up to 120 stickers. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of sticker set owner

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set isn't changed.

setStickerPositionInSet.name: setStickerPositionInSet
description: Use this method to move a sticker in a set created by the bot to a specific position. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

fields.name: position
fields.description: New sticker position in the set, zero-based

deleteStickerFromSet.name: deleteStickerFromSet
description: Use this method to delete a sticker from a set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

replaceStickerInSet.name: replaceStickerInSet
description: Use this method to replace an existing sticker in a sticker set with a new one. The method is equivalent to calling deleteStickerFromSet, then addStickerToSet, then setStickerPositionInSet. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: old_sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the replaced sticker

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set remains unchanged.

setStickerEmojiList.name: setStickerEmojiList
description: Use this method to change the list of emoji assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

fields.name: emoji_list
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker

setStickerKeywords.name: setStickerKeywords
description: Use this method to change search keywords assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters

setStickerMaskPosition.name: setStickerMaskPosition
description: Use this method to change the mask position of a mask sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

fields.name: mask_position
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object with the position where the mask should be placed on faces. Omit the parameter to remove the mask position.

setStickerSetTitle.name: setStickerSetTitle
description: Use this method to set the title of a created sticker set. Returns True on success.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: title
fields.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

setStickerSetThumbnail.name: setStickerSetThumbnail
description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a regular or mask sticker set. The format of the thumbnail file must match the format of the stickers in the set. Returns True on success.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: A .WEBP or .PNG image with the thumbnail, must be up to 128 kilobytes in size and have a width and height of exactly 100px, or a .TGS animation with a thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size (see https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animation-requirements for animated sticker technical requirements), or a .WEBM video with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-requirements for video sticker technical requirements. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files. Animated and video sticker set thumbnails can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. If omitted, then the thumbnail is dropped and the first sticker is used as the thumbnail.

fields.name: format
fields.description: Format of the thumbnail, must be one of "static" for a .WEBP or .PNG image, "animated" for a .TGS animation, or "video" for a .WEBM video

setCustomEmojiStickerSetThumbnail.name: setCustomEmojiStickerSetThumbnail
description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a custom emoji sticker set. Returns True on success.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Custom emoji identifier of a sticker from the sticker set; pass an empty string to drop the thumbnail and use the first sticker as the thumbnail.

deleteStickerSet.name: deleteStickerSet
description: Use this method to delete a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

answerInlineQuery.name: answerInlineQuery
description: Use this method to send answers to an inline query. On success, True is returned.
No more than 50 results per query are allowed.

fields.name: inline_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the answered query

fields.name: results
fields.description: A JSON-serialized array of results for the inline query

fields.name: cache_time
fields.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.

fields.name: is_personal
fields.description: Pass True if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query.

fields.name: next_offset
fields.description: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.

fields.name: button
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object describing a button to be shown above inline query results

answerWebAppQuery.name: answerWebAppQuery
description: Use this method to set the result of an interaction with a Web App and send a corresponding message on behalf of the user to the chat from which the query originated. On success, a SentWebAppMessage object is returned.

fields.name: web_app_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

fields.name: result
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object describing the message to be sent

savePreparedInlineMessage.name: savePreparedInlineMessage
description: Stores a message that can be sent by a user of a Mini App. Returns a PreparedInlineMessage object.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user that can use the prepared message

fields.name: result
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object describing the message to be sent

fields.name: allow_user_chats
fields.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to private chats with users

fields.name: allow_bot_chats
fields.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to private chats with bots

fields.name: allow_group_chats
fields.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to group and supergroup chats

fields.name: allow_channel_chats
fields.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to channel chats

sendInvoice.name: sendInvoice
description: Use this method to send invoices. On success, the sent Message is returned.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: message_thread_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

fields.name: title
fields.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

fields.name: description
fields.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use it for your internal processes.

fields.name: provider_token
fields.description: Payment provider token, obtained via @BotFather. Pass an empty string for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies. Pass "XTR" for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: prices
fields.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: max_tip_amount
fields.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: suggested_tip_amounts
fields.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

fields.name: start_parameter
fields.description: Unique deep-linking parameter. If left empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice. If non-empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter

fields.name: provider_data
fields.description: JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

fields.name: photo_url
fields.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

fields.name: photo_size
fields.description: Photo size in bytes

fields.name: photo_width
fields.description: Photo width

fields.name: photo_height
fields.description: Photo height

fields.name: need_name
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_phone_number
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_email
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_shipping_address
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
fields.description: Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: send_email_to_provider
fields.description: Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: is_flexible
fields.description: Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: disable_notification
fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: protect_content
fields.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

fields.name: allow_paid_broadcast
fields.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

fields.name: message_effect_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

fields.name: reply_parameters
fields.description: Description of the message to reply to

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Pay total price' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.

createInvoiceLink.name: createInvoiceLink
description: Use this method to create a link for an invoice. Returns the created invoice link as String on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the link will be created. For payments in Telegram Stars only.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

fields.name: description
fields.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use it for your internal processes.

fields.name: provider_token
fields.description: Payment provider token, obtained via @BotFather. Pass an empty string for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies. Pass "XTR" for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: prices
fields.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: subscription_period
fields.description: The number of seconds the subscription will be active for before the next payment. The currency must be set to "XTR" (Telegram Stars) if the parameter is used. Currently, it must always be 2592000 (30 days) if specified. Any number of subscriptions can be active for a given bot at the same time, including multiple concurrent subscriptions from the same user. Subscription price must no exceed 10000 Telegram Stars.

fields.name: max_tip_amount
fields.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: suggested_tip_amounts
fields.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

fields.name: provider_data
fields.description: JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

fields.name: photo_url
fields.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service.

fields.name: photo_size
fields.description: Photo size in bytes

fields.name: photo_width
fields.description: Photo width

fields.name: photo_height
fields.description: Photo height

fields.name: need_name
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_phone_number
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_email
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_shipping_address
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
fields.description: Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: send_email_to_provider
fields.description: Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: is_flexible
fields.description: Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

answerShippingQuery.name: answerShippingQuery
description: If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter is_flexible was specified, the Bot API will send an Update with a shipping_query field to the bot. Use this method to reply to shipping queries. On success, True is returned.

fields.name: shipping_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

fields.name: ok
fields.description: Pass True if delivery to the specified address is possible and False if there are any problems (for example, if delivery to the specified address is not possible)

fields.name: shipping_options
fields.description: Required if ok is True. A JSON-serialized array of available shipping options.

fields.name: error_message
fields.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. "Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

answerPreCheckoutQuery.name: answerPreCheckoutQuery
description: Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Bot API sends the final confirmation in the form of an Update with the field pre_checkout_query. Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries. On success, True is returned. Note: The Bot API must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

fields.name: pre_checkout_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

fields.name: ok
fields.description: Specify True if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order. Use False if there are any problems.

fields.name: error_message
fields.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

getStarTransactions.name: getStarTransactions
description: Returns the bot's Telegram Star transactions in chronological order. On success, returns a StarTransactions object.

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Number of transactions to skip in the response

fields.name: limit
fields.description: The maximum number of transactions to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

refundStarPayment.name: refundStarPayment
description: Refunds a successful payment in Telegram Stars. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Identifier of the user whose payment will be refunded

fields.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
fields.description: Telegram payment identifier

editUserStarSubscription.name: editUserStarSubscription
description: Allows the bot to cancel or re-enable extension of a subscription paid in Telegram Stars. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Identifier of the user whose subscription will be edited

fields.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
fields.description: Telegram payment identifier for the subscription

fields.name: is_canceled
fields.description: Pass True to cancel extension of the user subscription; the subscription must be active up to the end of the current subscription period. Pass False to allow the user to re-enable a subscription that was previously canceled by the bot.

setPassportDataErrors.name: setPassportDataErrors
description: Informs a user that some of the Telegram Passport elements they provided contains errors. The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Returns True on success.

Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier

fields.name: errors
fields.description: A JSON-serialized array describing the errors

sendGame.name: sendGame
description: Use this method to send a game. On success, the sent Message is returned.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat

fields.name: message_thread_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

fields.name: game_short_name
fields.description: Short name of the game, serves as the unique identifier for the game. Set up your games via @BotFather.

fields.name: disable_notification
fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: protect_content
fields.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

fields.name: allow_paid_broadcast
fields.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

fields.name: message_effect_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

fields.name: reply_parameters
fields.description: Description of the message to reply to

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Play game_title' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must launch the game.

setGameScore.name: setGameScore
description: Use this method to set the score of the specified user in a game message. On success, if the message is not an inline message, the Message is returned, otherwise True is returned. Returns an error, if the new score is not greater than the user's current score in the chat and force is False.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier

fields.name: score
fields.description: New score, must be non-negative

fields.name: force
fields.description: Pass True if the high score is allowed to decrease. This can be useful when fixing mistakes or banning cheaters

fields.name: disable_edit_message
fields.description: Pass True if the game message should not be automatically edited to include the current scoreboard

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

getGameHighScores.name: getGameHighScores
description: Use this method to get data for high score tables. Will return the score of the specified user and several of their neighbors in a game. Returns an Array of GameHighScore objects.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Target user id

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message
